verses.verse: Now <WG1161> I <WG1473> Paul, <WG3972> myself, <WG846> entreat <WG3870> you <WG5209> by <WG1223> the humility <WG4236> and <WG2532> gentleness <WG1932> of Christ; <WG5547> I who <WG3739> in <WG2596> your presence <WG4383> am <WG3303> lowly <WG5011> among <WG1722> you, <WG5209> but <WG1161> being absent <WG548> am bold <WG2292> toward <WG1519> you. <WG5209>

Yes, <WG1161> I beg <WG1189> you that I may <WG2292> not, <WG3361> when present, <WG3918> show courage <WG2292> with the confidence <WG4006> with which I intend <WG3049> to be bold <WG5111> against <WG1909> some, <WG5100> who <WG3739> consider <WG3049> us <WG2248> to be <WG5613> walking <WG4043> according to <WG2596> the flesh. <WG4561>
For <WG1063> though we walk <WG4043> in <WG1722> the flesh, <WG4561> we <WG4754> don't <WG3756> wage war <WG4754> according <WG2596> to the flesh; <WG4561>

for <WG1063> the weapons <WG3696> of our <WG2257> warfare <WG4752> are not <WG3756> of the flesh, <WG4559> but <WG235> mighty <WG1415> before God <WG2316> to <WG4314> the throwing down <WG2506> of strongholds, <WG3794>

throwing down <WG2507> imaginations <WG3053> and <WG2532> every <WG3956> high thing <WG5313> that is exalted <WG1869> against <WG2596> the knowledge <WG1108> of God, <WG2316> and <WG2532> bringing every <WG3956> thought <WG3540> into captivity <WG163> to <WG1519> the obedience <WG5218> of Christ; <WG5547>
and <WG2532> being <WG2192> in <WG1722> readiness <WG2092> to avenge <WG1556> all <WG3956> disobedience, <WG3876> when <WG3752> your <WG5216> obedience <WG5218> will be made full. <WG4137>

Do you look <WG991> at things <WG3588> only as <WG2596> they appear in front of your face? <WG4383> If <WG1487> anyone trusts <WG3982> in himself <WG1438> that he is <WG1511> Christ <WG5547>'s, let him <WG3049> consider <WG3049> this <WG5124> again <WG3825> with <WG575> himself, <WG1438> that, <WG3754> even <WG2532> as <WG2531> he <WG846> is Christ <WG5547>'s, so <WG3779> also <WG2532> we <WG2249> are Christ <WG5547>'s.

For <WG1063> though <WG1437> <WG99999> I should boast <WG2744> <WG2532> somewhat <WG5100> abundantly <WG4053> concerning <WG4012> our <WG2257> authority, <WG1849> (which <WG3739> the Lord <WG2962> gave <WG1325> <WG2254> for <WG1519> building <WG3619> you up, <WG2532> and not <WG3756> for <WG1519> casting you <WG5216> down <WG2506>) I will <WG153> not <WG3756> be disappointed, <WG153>
that <WG2443> I may <WG1380> not <WG3361> seem <WG1380> as <WG5613> if <WG302> I desire to terrify <WG1629> you <WG5209> by <WG1223> my letters. <WG1992>

For, <WG3754> "His letters, <WG3303>" they <WG5346> say, <WG926> "are weighty and <WG2532> strong, <WG2478> but <WG1161> his bodily <WG4983> presence <WG3952> is weak, <WG772> and <WG2532> his speech <WG3056> is despised. <WG1848>"

Let <WG3049> such a person <WG5108> consider <WG3049> this, <WG5124> that <WG3754> what <WG3634> we are <WG2070> in word <WG3056> by <WG1223> letters <WG1992> when we are absent, <WG548> such <WG5108> are we also <WG2532> in deed <WG2041> when we are present. <WG3918>

For <WG1063> we are not <WG3756> bold <WG5111> to number <WG1469> or <WG2228> compare <WG4793> ourselves <WG1438> with some <WG5100> of those who commend <WG4921> themselves. <WG1438> But <WG235> they <WG846> themselves, <WG3354> measuring themselves <WG1438> by <WG1722> themselves, <WG1438> and <WG2532> comparing <WG4793> themselves <WG1438> with themselves, <WG1438> are <WG4920> without <WG3756> understanding. <WG4920>

But <WG1161> we <WG2249> will <WG2744> not <WG3780> boast <WG2744> <WG1519> <WG3588> beyond <WG280> proper limits, <WG280> but <WG235> within <WG2596> the <WG3358> boundaries <WG2583> with which <WG3739> God <WG2316> appointed <WG3307> to <WG2596> us, <WG2254> which reach <WG2185> even <WG2532> to <WG891> you. <WG5216>

For <WG1063> we don't <WG3756> stretch <WG5239> ourselves <WG1438> too much, <WG5239> as though <WG5613> we didn't <WG3361> reach <WG2185> to <WG1519> you. <WG5209> For <WG1063> we came <WG5348> even <WG2532> as far as <WG891> to you <WG5216> with <WG1722> the Good News <WG2098> of Christ, <WG5547>

not <WG3756> boasting <WG2744> <WG1519> <WG3588> beyond <WG280> proper limits <WG280> in <WG1722> other men <WG245>'s labors, <WG2873> but <WG1161> having <WG2192> hope <WG1680> that as your <WG5216> faith <WG4102> grows, <WG837> we will be abundantly <WG4050> enlarged <WG3170> by <WG1722> you <WG5213> <WG2596> in <WG1519> our <WG2257> sphere of influence, <WG2583>

so as to preach the Good News <WG2097> even to <WG1519> the parts beyond <WG5238> you, <WG5216> not <WG3756> to boast <WG2744> in <WG1722> what <WG2583> someone <WG245> else has already <WG1519> done. <WG2092>
But <WG1161> "he <WG3588> who boasts, <WG2744> let him boast <WG2744> in <WG1722> the Lord. <WG2962>"
For <WG1063> it isn't <WG3756> he who <WG1565> commends <WG4921> himself <WG1438> who is <WG2076> approved, <WG1384> but <WG235> whom <WG3739> the Lord <WG2962> commends. <WG4921>
